headline: Waste Management beats quarterly estimates on higher pricing
summary: Waste Management beat second-quarter profit and revenue estimates on Monday, aided by higher pricing and steady demand for garbage collection and disposal. WM, which collects and transfers trash to company landfills and recycles it into energy, has benefited from the use of automation, cutting labor costs and boosting efficiency. Alongside municipal waste departments, WM and Republic Services are two major companies that lead garbage collection across significant regions of the United States.

headline: Waste Management (WM) Q2 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: Waste Management (WM) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +1.59% and +1.39%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Republic Services Marks Emissions Reduction Milestone in Latest Sustainability Report
summary: Republic Services, Inc. (NYSE: RSG), a leader in the environmental services industry, today released its 2024 Sustainability Report, highlighting meaningful progress toward its 2030 Safety, Talent, Climate Leadership and Communities goals. Notably, the company achieved a 20% reduction in greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in 2024 over its 2017 baseline, far exceeding its interim target of a 10% reduction by 2025.

headline: Republic Services (RSG) Reports Earnings Tomorrow: What To Expect
summary: Waste management company Republic Services (NYSE:RSG) will be reporting results this Tuesday afternoon. Here’s what you need to know.
